**Government of Canada - Request for Standing Offer for Environmental and Geotechnical Engineering Services**

[Assigned Contracting Point of Contact Information]

**Solicitation Information**

* Amendment Number: 6

**Timeline**
* Publication Date: October 26, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: January 22, 2024 at 14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: January 8, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: January 8, 2027

**Procurement Details**
* Solicitation Type: Request for Standing Offer
* Procurement Category: SRV (Services)
* Procurement Method: Competitive Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Highest Combined Rating for Technical Merit and Price
* Trade Agreements: Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), and others.

**Contract Requirements**
* The successful consultants shall provide a range of environmental and geotechnical services for projects in the National Capital Region.
* The selected consultants will have their offerings evaluated for their technical and financial proposal for the Stand-Off offers for up to 3 years, with option for extending up to 2 years.

**Instructions to Bidders**
* Late submissions will not be accepted.
* Proposals may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

****Do not** try to use Markdown formatting here, just keep going**

For the evaluation criteria, following a one-phase submission process, the selected contractors will be evaluated on technical merit and price during this competitive procurement. The Standing Offers for an anticipated four (4) consultants will be authorized by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PWGSC) and will be valid for a period of three (3) years. The contractors may extend their agreements beyond the initial time period of three years. 

The contractors will need to have a variety of environmental and geotechnical engineering services. They should be bilingual in order to support multiple areas including the stemming of project development and geotechnical monitoring. Any submitted offers should include extensive services for geotechnical monitoring among others. 

Please be advised, according to the Contracts Act of Canada, either late or incomplete submissions will not be qualified for motions during the duration of this request. It is advised to familiarize yourself with full terms and circumstances in the listed documents so as to proceed with this solicitation and bid.
